intro: Liparia latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf liparia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Liparia latifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
